intro: Phoebe neuranthoides, commonly known as the small-leaf phoebe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically less than 5 cm in length. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale green, followed by dark blue or black berries. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as humid forests and mountainous regions.
